intro: Eriosema benguellense, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate and trifoliate, with small, rounded leaflets. Eriosema benguellense thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
